0.user_question: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 12 cups of flour 14 cups of sugar and 7 cups of salt. She already put in 2 cups of flour. How many more cups of flour than cups of salt does she need to add now?

ost_step.1: To make the cake Mary needs 12 cups of flour but she only has 10 cups left (because she added 2).
ost_step.2: 2 less than 12 is 10, so that is the amount of flour she still needs.
ost_step.3: Mary also needs 14 cups of sugar.
ost_step.4: The problem asks how much more flour than salt she needs, so we need to subtract the amount of salt from the amount of flour needed: 10 (flour) - 7 (salt) = 3.
